column5: This is bloody difficult... The only one I'm really sure about is the number 1 spot.
What can I say, as a child I wanted to become a paleontologist, and my favorite director is Steven Spielberg. Combine that and it gets the silvery second place.
Action-packed, exciting, rewatchable and has one of the best use of a ticking clock that results in one of cinema's best climaxes.
I was blown away when I first saw this film.
This one has grown to become, paradoxically, my comfort movie.
This movie elicited a feeling of awe in me that I hadn't gotten from movies since childhood.
Shows you what a film boils down to; Great acting and a fantastic screenplay.
Some scene of this movie is my favorite scenes ever.
Love the atmosphere, the case, the detectives, and the killer.
I love samurais, and I loved that it was a western.
